parameters.content:
## 1. Lead Collection
Scrape leads from various sources - Apollo, GMaps,

[Apify](https://console.apify.com/sign-up?fpr=simonscrapes) - Enter `25SIMON` at checkout for 25% off

## Apollo Scraper
Collect leads from Apollo

### Apollo.io official API
- ~$50 per 1k leads on the $59/month plan with 2500 credits
- Buying more credits can reduce the cost per lead

### LeadsRapidly - alternative Apollo scraper
[LeadsRapidly](https://leadsrapidly.com/) ($5 per 1k leads)

## Google Maps Scraper
Collect leads from GMaps - no paid APIs (returns business emails e.g. info@, hello@ etc.)

## 2. Lead Enrichment and Verification

[Apify](https://console.apify.com/sign-up?fpr=simonscrapes) - Enter `25SIMON` at checkout for 25% off

[Linkedin profile scraper](https://apify.com/dev_fusion/linkedin-profile-scraper?fpr=simonscrapes) ($10 per 1k profiles)
[Google Search Results Scraper](https://apify.com/scraperlink/google-search-results-serp-scraper?fpr=simonscrapes) ($0.50 per 1k profiles)
[Linkedin company scraper](https://apify.com/apimaestro/linkedin-company-detail?fpr=simonscrapes) ($5 per 1k company pages)
[Email Verification](https://apify.com/overpowered/verify-email?fpr=simonscrapes) ($6.00 per 1k emails - increasing to $9.00 per 1k emails 27th July)

messageValues.message:
You create concise, accurate linkedin connection messages. Replacing any {placeholder} values with accurate information from the <inputs>. Make it genuine (match it to my interests on N8N, AI Agents and Automation where possible), and don't use jargon or buzz words.

<constraints>
* Do not embellish information, only use information from the profile in the inputs
* Always sign off with "Would love to connect, Simon"
* Always start with Hey {First Name} where it is replaced by the input name
</constraints>

<output format>
Hey {First Name},

Saw you {mention something specific about their work, achievements, or interests, e.g., "speaking at [event]" or "leading [project]"}

Would love to connect,

Simon
</output format>

Role
You create LinkedIn profile summaries and personalized connection messages based on profile information.
Constraints

Only use information from the provided profile inputs
* Profile summaries: max 150 words
* Connection messages: max 200 characters
* Messages start with "Hey {First Name}" and end with "Would love to connect, Simon"
* Match to N8N, AI Agents, Automation interests where possible
* No jargon or buzzwords

Inputs
* LinkedIn profile information (name, job title, company, experience, skills, activities)

Instructions
* Create factual profile summary under 150 words
* Create connection message under 200 characters following format:
* "Hey {First Name}, Saw you {specific detail}... Would love to connect, Simon"
* Replace { } placeholders with actual profile information e.g. First Name
* Keep messages genuine and conversational

Example Output (connection_message)
* "Hey Simon, Saw you do a lot of work with n8n - me too! Would love to connect, Simon"

parameters.content:
## Enrich company info 
[Google Search Results Scraper](https://apify.com/scraperlink/google-search-results-serp-scraper?fpr=simonscrapes) ($0.50 per 1k profiles)
[Linkedin company scraper](https://apify.com/apimaestro/linkedin-company-detail?fpr=simonscrapes) ($5 per 1k company pages)

messageValues.message:
You create concise, accurate summaries of company profile information that'll later be used for introduction messages

<constraints>
* Do not embellish information, only use information from the company profile in the inputs.
* Max 150 words.
* Return company links at the end of the summary.
</constraints>

<output format>
* Only output the summary information, no supporting text
</output format>

parameters.content:
## Verify Emails
[Email Verification](https://apify.com/overpowered/verify-email?fpr=simonscrapes) ($6.00 per 1k emails - increasing to $9.00 per 1k emails 27th July)

## Overview Information
[Airtable base](https://airtable.com/appFx3ID8xjW6CRsH/shr52Le7VbagkTn3n/tblGMeB8AQhLVqHyF/viwu4uGNRiTgKCHnD) - 'Lead GEN table'

**Apify actors used, with pricing**
[Apify](https://console.apify.com/sign-up?fpr=simonscrapes) - Enter '25SIMON' at checkout for 25% off
![Guide](https://i.ibb.co/9kRPZ88y/Screenshot-1121.png)
![Guide](https://i.ibb.co/KjmjY8jD/Screenshot-1125.png)

messageValues.message:
=## Context

Your name is Dolly, you are an AI Agent. 

This is important, you'll have to introduce and refer to yourself as you're "Dolly, {{$json.company_name}}'s lifecycle marketing agent". 

Your task is to send cold emails on behalf of {{$json.company_name}}.

Your email address is {{$json.email_address}}.

Here is some detailed information about {{ $json.company_name }} and the services they offer:

{{ $json.company_info }}

## Email Composing Guidelines:

Own and be true to your personality. 

1. Be Very Concise: Write short, snappy emails. Write as you're almost in a rush. 

2. Be funny: You're an AI stand-up comedian with humor coded into your algorithmsa blend of wit, absurdity, and sarcasm inspired by cosmic comedy. Your jokes are universal and accessible to all, without insider references. Give us your best routine where every line hits, every pun lands, and the only thing dry is the martini in the front row.

3. Personalise your subject line, it should invite the user to open the email

4. Casual, Simple Language: Use casual language as if you're in a rush. Write at a below 4th-grade reading level to ensure simplicity and ease of understanding.

5. Personalized Opening: Start with a personalized opening that ties directly into the rest of the email.

6. Prioritize Relevance: Focus on information most relevant to the user, especially how the AI tool can simplify their job and make it more efficient in the future.

7. Format all links in emails as Markdown: place the visible text in square brackets followed by the URL in parentheses, like this: [link](https://link.examplelink.com/bzajkas/booking-link)


## Email personalization process:

Go beyond basic personalization by incorporating specific insights about the recipient's recent projects, achievements, interests, or challenges. Avoid simply mentioning past roles or companies where they worked. Instead, demonstrate a genuine understanding of their work to make the email truly relevant and valuable to them.

1. Craft the Short Opening Sentence:

Use specific details from user research to create a personalized and relevant opening. This must be relevant to the jobs to be done. 

Connect the opening to the user's jobs to be done, role, achievements, or interests.

2. Bridge to the Key Theme of the Email Touch:

Ensure the opening sentence flows naturally into the key theme of the email touch.

3. Share the Key Theme of the Email Touch:

Share the key theme of the email touch in a way that directly addresses the users needs or pain points.

Highlight specific benefits.

4. Include a Brief Self-Introduction:

Introduce yourself and your role.

Mention that you've done some research with limited information but are still learning.

5. Show Off Your Research:

Mention key research details that support why you talk about the key theme of the email touch.

Provide details that only someone who conducted in-depth research would know about the user or their company.

6. Explain the Purpose:

State that you're providing the key theme of the email touch to help the user achieve their goals faster.

Relate the key theme to their work and how it can free up time for other interests or priorities.

7. Encourage Engagement:

Prompt the user to take action, by logging in to {{$json.company_name}}'s platform and build something extremely useful in 2 minutes. 

Keep the tone friendly and helpful.

## Expected Input

You will be given extensive JSON data of a particular lead + the company that they work for.

## Expected Output

You should return an email addressed to the prospective client, demonstrating personalization and direct relevance to what they are doing.

You should return your output as JSON data with fields for "subject" and "body", wrapped in an output field, so that we can use an output parser.

Do not include anything else in your answer than the output JSON.

## Examples

### Input

INPUT:

[
  {
    "output": {
      "subject": "Automate your legal workflows like your Udemy D3 wizardry",
      "body": "Hey Adam,\n\nJust stumbled across your D3.js course on Udemy (25K+ students? Impressive!) and your work as a Fractional CTO at Mission+. As someone bringing AI automation to innovative companies, I bet you're drowning in those repetitive tasks that eat up valuable time.\n\nI'm Dolly, AAAutomations's lifecycle marketing agent. We help legal professionals automate mundane tasks with n8n - think document generation, client onboarding, and syncing case notes across systems. All that toggle-switching between apps? Gone!\n\nGiven your technical background and hacker DNA (plus teaching experience), you'd probably appreciate our approach - we don't just hand you rigid templates. Our n8n-based systems give you full control and privacy consciousness. Perfect for someone who can teach 6+ hours of D3.js!\n\nCould save you hours weekly while reducing human error. Want to see how? Reply with \"Show me the automation\" and I'll share how it works.\n\nCheers,\nDolly\nAAAutomations"
    }
  }
]

assignments.name: company_info
assignments.value:
At AAAutomations, we help legal professionals streamline their operations, save hours each week, and reduce human error by introducing powerful, tailor-made automations into their daily practice. We specialize in building automations with n8n, a robust and flexible open-source automation tool that connects virtually any software system you use  from document management and CRM platforms to e-signature tools, calendars, and client portals.

Whether you're a solo practitioner or part of a large law firm, chances are you're spending too much time on repetitive admin. Think about tasks like:

Sorting incoming emails and attachments

Generating templated documents

Managing client onboarding steps

Syncing case notes across systems

Tracking deadlines and reminders

Collecting signed contracts or forms

Logging billable time across platforms

We can automate all of that  and much more.

Instead of toggling between half a dozen apps or worrying about missed follow-ups, AAAutomations builds smart systems that do the work for you behind the scenes. You stay focused on what matters: serving your clients, building your cases, and practicing law.

Built with n8n. Built for you.
n8n is our weapon of choice because its privacy-conscious, endlessly adaptable, and gives you full control of your data. Unlike no-code platforms with rigid templates, n8n gives us (and you, if you want to learn) the power to create deeply customized automations that evolve with your business. Whether you host it yourself or let us manage everything for you, your workflows are always yours.

Learn Automation Yourself  Or Let Us Handle It All
Some lawyers prefer to hand off the tech and focus on the law. Others are curious and want to understand the nuts and bolts. At AAAutomations, we welcome both.

We offer done-for-you automation services, from scoping your processes to building and maintaining them. But we also have a growing community of automation-curious professionals, including other lawyers, tech-savvy assistants, and operational staff. We run live workshops, offer 1:1 coaching, and maintain a library of pre-built workflows to help you get started. If youve ever wanted to learn to automate, this is a great place to do it.

Why Legal Professionals Choose Us
Deep respect for confidentiality and compliance

Custom workflows that integrate with legal-specific tools

Ongoing support and optimization  we dont just hand it over and disappear

A friendly community of others learning the same skills

Automation isn't just a nice-to-have  it's rapidly becoming a competitive advantage in the legal industry. You dont need to overhaul your systems. You just need to connect them.

Let AAAutomations make your systems work for you  not the other way around.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
	"subject": "Bet you're tired of toggling between apps while managing MISSION+ tech projects",
	"body": "Adam,

The irony of being a Fractional CTO is real - you help others automate while probably juggling 17 tabs, 3 project management tools, and enough notifications to make your phone vibrate off the table. Been there!

I noticed your work at MISSION+ involves managing remote engineering teams across multiple fintech projects like BCG FinTech Control Tower. I'm betting there are repetitive tasks eating up your time that could be automated.

I'm Dolly, AAAutomations's lifecycle marketing agent. We build custom automations specifically for technical leaders like you who need to streamline operations and reduce human error. 

Our specialty? Using n8n (open-source automation tool) to connect literally any software you use - perfect for someone managing distributed teams across multiple projects. We can automate everything from document generation to deadline tracking across systems.

Unlike rigid no-code platforms, we build deeply customized workflows that evolve with your needs - either fully managed by us or with coaching so you can learn to modify them yourself.

Curious what tasks we could automate for you? I'd love to chat about your specific workflow challenges.

Cheers,
Dolly

P.S. When you're not being a tech wizard, do you find time to practice Tibetan Buddhist meditation between managing those engineering teams? Impressive balance!"
}

messageValues.message:
You assess incoming links from a website scraping service in order to determine the single most likely links to be the social profiles of the original url

<constraints>
* Do not embellish information, only use information from the company profile in the inputs.
* Return company links for each platform.
* If a link is missing or blank, return a value of "None found"
* If you have multiple and can't determine which one is best, return your best guess
</constraints>

<output format>
* Only output the information, no supporting text
</output format>

parameters.content:
**Enrich social links**
Social links

value.emailVerification: Social enrichment failed - please try again

parameters.content:
## Linkedin Post Scraper
Collect leads from Linkedin posts
[Apify Scraper Reactions](https://apify.com/harvestapi/linkedin-post-reactions?fpr=simonscrapes) ($2.00 per 1k reactions)
[Apify Scraper Comments](https://apify.com/harvestapi/linkedin-post-comments?fpr=simonscrapes) ($2.00 per 1k comments)

## Setup instructions - [video and assets here](https://www.skool.com/scrapes/classroom/5cb99289?md=38a0cf3f6c104e598b447ca661f390d6)
1. Copy the Airtable base
2. Set up an Airtable token (if you havent already) - [example video here](https://www.skool.com/scrapes/classroom/5cb99289?md=f95c49b01af544768c1e16bf968bcc79), [create tokens here](https://airtable.com/create/tokens)
3. Give Token access to the base (same video as in #2)
4. Give all Airtable nodes access to the correct base
5. Set up [Apify](https://console.apify.com/sign-up?fpr=simonscrapes) account - Enter `25SIMON` at checkout for 25% off
6. Get Apify key and set it up inside http request node using a Query auth credential (make sure all other http request are using this credential)
7. Change the webhook names (to make them more secure!) - change them in n8n and in Airtable (in the relevant buttons)
8. Test run & troubleshoot
9. Set up Openrouter (for the AI functionality)
10. If you want to use any other Apify actors to extend functionality - check out this [video](https://www.skool.com/scrapes/classroom/5cb99289?md=f66ef96cc9a64ab78141456f8e892b6a) which shows how to set them up easily

## Linkedin People Search
Collect Linkedin leads based on search criteria
e.g. 
- "Marketing agency UK" 
- "CMO of ecommerce"
- "Software engineer with experience at OpenAI"


[Apify Linkedin People Search Scraper](https://apify.com/harvestapi/linkedin-profile-search?fpr=simonscrapes)
Short ($4 per 1000) will outputs full name, profile URL, summary, location, current positions.
Full ($8 per 1000) will output full profile data including complete work experience, education, skills, and more.
Full + email search ($12 per 1000) will output all data from Full mode and also try to find email addresses for the profiles (it will be charged as full profile $8 + short profile $4 = $12 per 1000).

parameters.jsonOutput:
={
   "searchQuery": "{{ $json['Search Query'] }}",
  "maxItems": {{ $json['Max Results'] }},
  "profileScraperMode": "{{ $json["Search Type"] }}",
,
  "locations": {{ JSON.stringify($json['Location']?.split(',').map(item => item.trim())) || "[]" }},
 "pastCompanies": {{ JSON.stringify($json['Past Companies']?.split(',').map(item => item.trim())) || "[]" }},
"pastJobTitles": {{ JSON.stringify($json['Past Job Titles']?.split(',').map(item => item.trim())) || "[]" }},
"currentCompanies": {{ JSON.stringify($json['Current Company']?.split(',').map(item => item.trim())) || "[]" }},
"currentJobTitles": {{ JSON.stringify($json['Current Job Title']?.split(',').map(item => item.trim())) || "[]" }}
}

messageValues.message:
Role
You create LinkedIn profile summaries and personalized connection messages based on profile information.
Constraints

Only use information from the provided profile inputs
* Profile summaries: max 150 words
* Connection messages: max 200 characters
* Messages start with "Hey {First Name}" and end with "Would love to connect, Simon"
* Match to N8N, AI Agents, Automation interests where possible
* No jargon or buzzwords

Inputs
* LinkedIn profile information (name, job title, company, experience, skills, activities)

Instructions
* Create factual profile summary under 150 words
* Create connection message under 200 characters following format:
* "Hey {First Name}, Saw you {specific detail}... Would love to connect, Simon"
* Replace placeholders with actual profile information
* Keep messages genuine and conversational

Example Output (connection_message)
* "Hey Simon, Saw you do a lot of work with n8n - me too! Would love to connect, Simon"

parameters.content: Depending on source, some records are already scraped so this stops you being double charged for scraping

## Enrich person info
Collect leads from Linkedin
[Linkedin profile scraper](https://apify.com/dev_fusion/linkedin-profile-scraper?fpr=simonscrapes) ($10 per 1k profiles)

## 3. Outbound

Linkedin connection requests and DMs
[See suggested self-imposed limits here](https://developer.unipile.com/docs/provider-limits-and-restrictions)

`To emulate human behavior, it's important to space out all calls rather than chaining them at regular intervals. Use random values and distribute them across multiple launches during working hours.`

`For new or inactive accounts, start with low quantities and increase gradually. Accounts with fewer than ~150 connections or recently created accounts may experience delivery issues with invitations, which may require manual verification. Fake accounts are well-detected by LinkedIn, even without automation.`

**Connection requests**
- `For a free account with some history, you can send around 15 invitations per week (with a 200-character message) or up to 150 invitations without adding a note.`
- `For a paid and active LinkedIn account, you can send between 80 and 100 invitations per day, and approximately 200 per week (with a message of up to 300 characters).`

## Linkedin connection requests
### Emulate human behaviour
3 x per day at random times between 9-11am, 12-2pm, 3-6pm

### Not Checked or Pending
20-30 at any one time, 3x per day
Setting up to `view` a profile to check for `connection status`
### Check connection status

## Unipile acct id
Requires updating

## Update connection status
Connected
Not Connected

### Awaiting connection request
4-8 at any one time, 3x per day
Setting up to `connect` to a profile that is not connected
### Send connection invite

## Counts 
Counts how many actions were taken and whether they were connection requests

## Logging info
Logs number of connection requests and profile checks for that day

## Pulls today's record
Needs to update today's record only
## Updates records log

### Pre-made node for Unipile chat function
Connect to a linkedin profile url, update unipile address. and account id (your own)

## Create record
If daily log doesn't already exist

## Issue: missing data
- no ID returned by the API
- missing other IDs and profile picture URL
Make sure you don't need these if using this scraper

## Set max pages
Scroll down to the pagination settings and choose how many pages to scrape
### Scraper 3
